CSS

Concept's CSS is modern. Here are the base styles.

Typography

All headers h1 through h6 have a default font of Helvetica Neue. All p tags have a default font of Merrieweather Sans. You can easily change these fonts by changing the variables $header-font and $paragraph-font, respectively, in variables.scss

Grid

Concept uses a responsive 12-column grid that can be changed from 1 to 50 columns with the $number-of-columns variable. The grid does not give any default padding or margin to columns or rows. Rather, these styles are added using special classes.

Buttons

Use a variety of classes to build buttons. Start by adding class .c-btn to any <button> or <a> element and add classes as you wish. Choose between 7 different sizes: extra small, small, normal, large, jumbo, fixed-width, or full-width. Choose between flat buttons, raised buttons, outline buttons, rectangle buttons, or clicky buttons.

Default Button.c-default

The default button is a basic button with white background (#eee), black text (#222), 1px border with same color as the background, and a 2px box-shadow that gives a raised look.




Button Types

Concept provides many alternative types you can use instead of the default raised style. Flat buttons (.c-flat) remove the box-shadow raised look, outline buttons (.c-outline) use a transparent background, rectangle buttons (.c-rect) remove rounded corners, clicky buttons (.c-clicky) appear pressed when hovered over, and text buttons (.c-text) appear as simple text and show a background color on hover.





Button Colors

Using a semantic color scheme communicates the function of the button to your users. Use a primary button color (.c-primary) to communicate importance. It's purple by default and can be changed with $primary-button-background-color. Use a success button (.c-success) for positive interactive buttons and a danger button (.c-danger) for negative interactive buttons. Use neutral if you want a nice neutral blue color! Transparent-dark (.c-transparent-dark) of transparent-light (.c-transparent-light) buttons are useful for interfaces with a photo background.




Button Sizes

Concept uses five sizes for buttons of dynamic width - extra small (.c-xs), small (.c-sm), normal (default), large (.c-lg), and jumbo (.c-jumbo). Fix the width of your button with fixed-width buttons (.c-fixed-width) or make it super jumbo huge with a full-width button (.c-full-width) that takes the full width of its containing element.




Button Helpers

Button text is capitalized by default. You can set to back to normal capitalization with (.c-capital) or lowercase with (.c-lowercase). Add a transition
